page.title: 04Fishing in the River Avon.
page.content: Fordingbridge has always attracted a large number of fishermen and the local inns and guest-houses have benefited from this. Today, fishing is not as good as it used to be due to excess weed and pollution. The species of fish to be found are: 1.{Coarse}- roach, chub, dace, pike, perch, barbel, eels and grayling. 2.{Trout}- brown, rainbow and sea. 3.{Salmon. Three methods are used: 1.{Float or Ledger}- Baits include maggots, worms, bread, luncheon meat, sweet-corn, hemp and wheat. 2.{Trout}- Fly or spin. 3.{Salmon}- Fly or spin. Licences are required for everyone over 12 years.(Wessex Water Authority) Permits are available to fish in certain areas, for example, the recreation ground.
